column5: Dad and i flew out of sioux lookout to root bay on lake st jo of sept 27,got picked up oct 5.Water was way low and fishing was tough at times till we found a pattern that worked.Best depth was 20-30 ft with a 3/8 jig and a 4in berkley ripple shad,fish were smaller on average than years past but still had a great time.Saw 4 moose total this trip.Here are some pics http://s26.photobucket.com/albums/c112/144550/Canada%202011/ mostly just different parts of the lake but there is some fish porn and cabin shots....enjoy...Eric
Beautiful countryside   Looks great, and some nice clean loking fish too ! Never too late Eric Thanks for the report.
Lake St Jo is on my bucket list, it is supposed to be a walleye and monster pike factory with limited fishing pressure. Good to hear you enjoyed it.
Great pictures.   :clapping: Moose pic is very cool.  Very disconcerting to see the lake leval so low.
Great pics, would love to head up there one day!
